00039 // The core tree traversal functions
00041 PropMap::mapped_type &PropMap::fetchEntry( const key_type &key )
00042 {
00043     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00044     return fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00045 }
00050 PropMap::mapped_type &PropMap::fetchEntry(
00051     PropMap &root,
00052     const isis::util::PropMap::propPathIterator at, const isis::util::PropMap::propPathIterator pathEnd )
00053 {
00054     propPath::const_iterator next = at;
00055     next++;
00056     base_type &rootRef = root;
00057     iterator found = root.find( *at );
00058 
00059     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (a proposed leaf in the PropMap)
00060         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00061             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00062             LOG_IF( ref.is_leaf(), Runtime, error )
00063                     << util::MSubject( found->first ) << " is a leaf, but was requested as a branch in "
00064                     << util::MSubject( util::list2string( at, pathEnd, "/" ) );
00065             return fetchEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00066         } else { // if we should create a sub-map
00067             //insert a empty branch (aka PropMap) at "*at" (and fetch the reference of that)
00068             return fetchEntry( rootRef[*at].getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); // and continue there
00069         }
00070     } else { //if its the leaf
00071         return rootRef[*at]; // (create and) return that entry
00072     }
00073 }
00074 
00075 const PropMap::mapped_type *PropMap::findEntry( const key_type &key )const
00076 {
00077     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00078     return findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00079 }
00084 const PropMap::mapped_type *PropMap::findEntry(
00085     const PropMap &root,
00086     const propPathIterator at, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00087 {
00088     propPathIterator next = at;
00089     next++;
00090     util::PropMap::const_iterator found = root.find( *at );
00091 
00092     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (aka the leaf)
00093         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00094             const mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00095             return findEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00096         }
00097     } else if ( found != root.end() ) {// if its the leaf and we found the entry
00098         return &found->second; // return that entry
00099     }
00100 
00101     return NULL;
00102 }
00103 bool PropMap::recursiveRemove( PropMap &root, const propPathIterator at, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00104 {
00105     bool ret = true;
00106 
00107     if ( at != pathEnd ) {
00108         propPathIterator next = at;
00109         next++;
00110         iterator found = root.find( *at );
00111 
00112         if ( found != root.end() ) {
00113             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00114 
00115             if ( ! ref.is_leaf() ) {
00116                 ret = recursiveRemove( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd );
00117 
00118                 if ( ref.getBranch().empty() )
00119                     root.erase( found ); // remove the now empty branch
00120             } else
00121                 root.erase( found );
00122         } else {
00123             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Entry " << util::MSubject( *at ) << " not found, skipping it";
00124             ret = false;
00125         }
00126     }
00127 
00128     return ret;
00129 }

00133 // Generic interface for accessing elements
00135 const PropertyValue &PropMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )const
00136 {
00137     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00138     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00139 
00140     if( ref && ref->is_leaf() ) {
00141         return ref->getLeaf();
00142     } else {
00143         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Property " << key << " not found. Returning empty property.";
00144         return emptyEntry.getLeaf();
00145     }
00146 }
00147 
00148 PropertyValue &PropMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )
00149 {
00150     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00151     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00152     LOG_IF( ! n.is_leaf(), Debug, error ) << "Using branch " << key << " as PropertyValue";
00153     return n.getLeaf();
00154 }
00155 
00156 const PropMap &PropMap::branch( const key_type &key ) const
00157 {
00158     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00159     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00160 
00161     if( ! ref ) {
00162         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Trying to access non existing branch " << key << ".";
00163         return emptyEntry.getBranch();
00164     } else {
00165         LOG_IF( ref->getBranch().empty(), Runtime, warning ) << "Accessing empty branch " << key;
00166         return ref->getBranch();
00167     }
00168 }
00169 PropMap &PropMap::branch( const key_type &key )
00170 {
00171     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00172     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00173     return n.getBranch();
00174 }
00175 
00176 bool PropMap::remove( const key_type &key )
00177 {
00178     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00179     return recursiveRemove( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00180 }
00181 
00182 bool PropMap::remove( const isis::util::PropMap &removeMap, bool keep_needed )
00183 {
00184     iterator thisIt = begin();
00185     bool ret = true;
00186 
00187     //remove everything that is also in second
00188     for ( const_iterator otherIt = removeMap.begin(); otherIt != removeMap.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00189         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00190         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first - so its the same property or propmap
00191             if ( ! thisIt->second.is_leaf() ) { //this is a branch
00192                 if ( ! otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) { // recurse if its a branch in the removal map as well
00193                     PropMap &mySub = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00194                     const PropMap &otherSub = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00195                     ret &= mySub.remove( otherSub );
00196 
00197                     if( mySub.empty() ) // delete my branch, if its empty
00198                         erase( thisIt++ );
00199                 } else {
00200                     LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Not deleting branch " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " because its no subtree in the removal map";
00201                     ret = false;
00202                 }
00203             } else if( !( thisIt->second.getLeaf().needed() && keep_needed ) ) { // this is a leaf
00204                 erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00205             }
00206         }
00207     }
00208 
00209     return ret;
00210 }

00214 // utilities
00216 bool PropMap::valid() const
00217 {
00218     //iterate through the whole map and return false as soon as we find something needed _and_ empty
00219     const const_iterator found = std::find_if( begin(), end(), treeInvalidP() );
00220     return found == end();
00221 }

00223 bool PropMap::empty() const
00224 {
00225     return base_type::empty();

00228 PropMap::diff_map PropMap::getDifference( const PropMap &other ) const
00229 {
00230     PropMap::diff_map ret;
00231     diffTree( other, ret, "" );
00232     return ret;
00233 }
00234 
00235 void PropMap::diffTree( const PropMap &other, PropMap::diff_map &ret, istring prefix ) const
00236 {
00237     const_iterator otherIt = other.begin();
00238 
00239     //insert everything that is in this, but not in second or is on both but differs
00240     for ( const_iterator thisIt = begin(); thisIt != end(); thisIt++ ) {
00241         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + thisIt->first;
00242 
00243         //find the closest match for thisIt->first in other (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00244         if ( continousFind( otherIt, other.end(), *thisIt, value_comp() ) ) { //otherIt->first == thisIt->first - so its the same property
00245             const mapped_type &first = thisIt->second, &second = otherIt->second;
00246 
00247             if ( ! ( first.is_leaf() || second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a branch
00248                 const PropMap &thisMap = first.getBranch();
00249                 const PropMap &refMap = second.getBranch();
00250                 thisMap.diffTree( refMap, ret, pathname + "/" );
00251             } else if ( ! ( first == second )  ) { // if they are not equal
00252                 const PropertyValue firstVal = first.is_leaf() ? first.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Type<std::string>( first.toString() ) );
00253                 const PropertyValue secondVal = second.is_leaf() ? second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Type<std::string>( second.toString() ) );
00254                 ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|value2))
00255                     ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00256                     std::make_pair(
00257                         pathname,   //the key
00258                         std::make_pair( firstVal, secondVal ) //pair of both values
00259                     )
00260                 );
00261             }
00262         } else { // if ref is not in the other map
00263             const PropertyValue firstVal = thisIt->second.is_leaf() ? thisIt->second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Type<std::string>( thisIt->second.toString() ) );
00264             ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|[empty]))
00265                 ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00266                 std::make_pair(
00267                     pathname,
00268                     std::make_pair( firstVal, PropertyValue() )
00269                 )
00270             );
00271         }
00272     }
00273 
00274     //insert everything that is in second but not in this
00275     const_iterator thisIt = begin();
00276 
00277     for ( otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00278         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + otherIt->first;
00279 
00280         if ( ! continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //there is nothing in this which has the same key as ref
00281             const PropertyValue secondVal = otherIt->second.is_leaf() ? otherIt->second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Type<std::string>( otherIt->second.toString() ) );
00282             ret.insert(
00283                 std::make_pair( // add (propertyname|([empty]|value2))
00284                     pathname,
00285                     std::make_pair( PropertyValue(), secondVal )
00286                 )
00287             );
00288         }
00289     }
00290 }
00291 
00292 void PropMap::make_unique ( const util::PropMap &other, bool removeNeeded )
00293 {
00294     iterator thisIt = begin();
00295 
00296     //remove everything that is also in second and equal (or also empty)
00297     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00298         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00299         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first  - so its the same property
00300             if ( ! removeNeeded && thisIt->second.getLeaf().needed() ) {//Skip needed
00301                 thisIt++;
00302                 continue;
00303             }
00304 
00305             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { //this is empty
00306                 if ( otherIt->second.empty() ) { //the other is empty
00307                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00308                 } else {
00309                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping the empty " << thisIt->first << " because its is not empty in the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00310                     thisIt++;
00311                 }
00312             } else if ( ! otherIt->second.empty() ) { // if the other is not empty as well
00313                 if ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) { //delete this, if they are equal
00314                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Removing " << *thisIt << " because its equal with the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00315                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00316                 } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { //but maybe they are branches
00317                     PropMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00318                     const PropMap &otherMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00319                     thisMap.make_unique( otherMap );
00320                     thisIt++;
00321                 }
00322             } else {//only the other is empty
00323                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping " << *thisIt << " because the other is empty";
00324                 thisIt++;
00325             }
00326         }
00327     }
00328 }

00331 PropMap::key_list PropMap::join( const isis::util::PropMap &other, bool overwrite )
00332 {
00333     key_list rejects;
00334     joinTree( other, overwrite, "", rejects );
00335     return rejects;
00336 }
00337 
00338 void PropMap::joinTree( const isis::util::PropMap &other, bool overwrite, util::istring prefix, PropMap::key_list &rejects )
00339 {
00340     iterator thisIt = begin();
00341 
00342     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) { //iterate through the elements of other
00343         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { // if the element is allready here
00344             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { // if ours is empty
00345                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Replacing empty property " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00346                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00347             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a subtree
00348                 PropMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00349                 const PropMap &refMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00350                 thisMap.joinTree( refMap, overwrite, prefix + thisIt->first + "/", rejects ); //recursion
00351             } else if ( overwrite ) { // otherwise replace ours by the other (if we shall overwrite)
00352                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Replacing property " << MSubject( *thisIt ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00353                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00354             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) ) { // otherwise put the other into rejected if its not equal to our
00355                 LOG( Debug, info )
00356                         << "Rejecting property " << MSubject( *otherIt )
00357                         << " because " << MSubject( thisIt->second ) << " is allready there";
00358                 rejects.insert( rejects.end(), prefix + otherIt->first );
00359             }
00360         } else { // ok we dont have that - just insert it
00361             std::pair<const_iterator, bool> inserted = insert( *otherIt );
00362             LOG_IF( inserted.second, Debug, verbose_info ) << "Inserted property " << MSubject( *inserted.first ) << ".";
00363         }
00364     }
00365 }

00368 void PropMap::linearize( flat_map &out, key_type key_prefix ) const
00369 {
00370     for ( const_iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++ ) {
00371         key_type key = ( key_prefix.empty() ? "" : key_prefix + pathSeperator ) + i->first;
00372 
00373         if ( i->second.is_leaf()  ) {
00374             out.insert( std::make_pair( key, i->second.getLeaf() ) );
00375         } else {
00376             i->second.getBranch().linearize( out, key );
00377         }
00378     }
00379 }
00380 
00381 bool PropMap::transform( key_type from,  key_type to, int dstId, bool delSource )
00382 {
00383     const PropertyValue &found = propertyValue( from );
00384     bool ret = false;
00385 
00386     if( ! found.empty() ) {
00387         util::TypeReference &dst = static_cast<util::TypeReference &>( propertyValue( to ) );
00388 
00389         if ( found->typeID() == dstId ) {
00390             if( from != to ) {
00391                 dst = found ;
00392                 ret = true;
00393             } else {
00394                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " into same type at same place.";
00395             }
00396         } else {
00397             LOG_IF( from == to, Debug, warning ) << "Transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " in place.";
00398             dst = found->copyToNewById( dstId );
00399             ret = !dst.empty();
00400         }
00401     }
00402 
00403     if ( ret && delSource )remove( from );
00404 
00405     return ret;
00406 }

00430 void PropMap::addNeededFromString( const std::string &needed )
00431 {
00432     const std::list<std::string> needList = util::string2list<std::string>( needed );
00433     //@todo util::string2list<std::string>( needed,' ' ) would be faster but less robust
00434     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Adding " << needed << " as needed";
00435     BOOST_FOREACH( std::list<std::string>::const_reference ref, needList ) {
00436         addNeeded( key_type( ref.c_str() ) );
00437     }
00438 }

00441 bool PropMap::hasProperty( const key_type &key ) const
00442 {
00443     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00444     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00445     return ( ref && ref->is_leaf() && ! ref->getLeaf().empty() );
00446 }
00448 bool PropMap::hasBranch( const key_type &key ) const
00449 {
00450     const propPath path = util::string2list<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00451     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00452     return ( ref && ! ref->is_leaf()  );
00453 }
00454 
00455 bool PropMap::rename( key_type oldname, key_type newname )
00456 {
00457     const mapped_type *old_e = findEntry( oldname );
00458     const mapped_type *new_e = findEntry( newname );
00459 
00460     if ( old_e ) {
00461         LOG_IF( new_e && ! new_e->empty(), Runtime, warning )
00462                 << "Overwriting " << std::make_pair( newname, *new_e ) << " with " << *old_e;
00463         fetchEntry( newname ) = *old_e;
00464         return remove( oldname );
00465     } else {
00466         LOG( Runtime, warning )
00467                 << "Cannot rename " << oldname << " it does not exist";
00468         return false;
00469     }
00470 }
00471 
00472 void PropMap::toCommonUnique( PropMap &common, std::set<key_type> &uniques, bool init )const
00473 {
00474     if ( init ) {
00475         common = *this;
00476         uniques.clear();
00477         return;
00478     } else {
00479         const diff_map difference = common.getDifference( *this );
00480         BOOST_FOREACH( const diff_map::value_type & ref, difference ) {
00481             uniques.insert( ref.first );
00482 
00483             if ( ! ref.second.first.empty() )common.remove( ref.first );//if there is something in common, remove it
00484         }
00485     }
00486 }
00487 
00488 std::ostream &PropMap::print( std::ostream &out, bool label )const
00489 {
00490     flat_map buff;
00491     linearize( buff );
00492     size_t key_len = 0;
00493 
00494     for ( flat_map::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00495         if ( key_len < i->first.length() )
00496             key_len = i->first.length();
00497 
00498     for ( flat_map::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00499         out << i->first << std::string( key_len - i->first.length(), ' ' ) + ":" << i->second.toString( label ) << std::endl;
00500 
00501     return out;
00502 }
00503 
00504 bool PropMap::trueP::operator()( const PropMap::value_type &ref ) const
00505 {
00506     return true;
00507 }
00508 bool PropMap::invalidP::operator()( const PropMap::value_type &ref ) const
00509 {
00510     return ref.second.getLeaf().needed() && ref.second.getLeaf().empty();
00511 }
00512 bool PropMap::treeInvalidP::operator()( const PropMap::value_type &ref ) const
00513 {
00514     if ( ref.second.is_leaf() ) {
00515         const PropertyValue &val = ref.second.getLeaf();
00516         return val.needed() && val.empty();
00517     } else  {
00518         return ! ref.second.getBranch().valid();
00519     }
00520 }
